briefdescription.para: The pointer to the memory block holding immutable data.
The pointer to the memory block holding mutable data.
Returns whether the view contains data or not.
Returns whether the view contains mutable data or not.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to the element of 1d immutable view at specified location.

simplesect.para: This method does not perform boundary checks in release build. In debug build, the method asserts that the index is not out of bounds.
Should be used carefully in performance-critical parts of the code, as inlining is not guaranteed.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the element to be returned.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to the element of 2d immutable view at specified location.

simplesect.para: This method does not perform boundary checks in release build. In debug build, the method asserts that the index is not out of bounds.
Should be used carefully in performance-critical parts of the code, as inlining is not guaranteed.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the element along the 0-th axis.
The index of the element along the 1-st axis.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to the element of 1d mutable view at specified location.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the element to be returned.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a reference to the element of 2d mutable view at specified location.

parameterdescription.para: The index of the element along the 0-th axis.
The index of the element along the 1-st axis.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a copy of the element of 1d immutable view located in USM at specified location. The data is copied from the device to the host after the dependency events are completed.

parameterdescription.para: The SYCL* queue object.
The index of the element to be returned.
The vector of events that the operation depends on.

memberdef.argsstring: (sycl::queue &queue, std::int64_t id0, std::int64_t id1, const event_vector &deps={}) const
memberdef.name: at_device

detaileddescription.para: Returns a copy of the element of 2d immutable view located in USM at specified location. The data is copied from the device to the host after the dependency events are completed.

parameterdescription.para: The SYCL* queue object.
The index of the element along the 0-th axis.
The index of the element along the 1-st axis.
The vector of events that the operation depends on.

detaileddescription.para: Get transposed multidimensional view. The shape and strides of the transposed multidimensional view are swapped.
The data is not modified or copied: The transposed ndview points to the same memory block as the original ndview.

Get the multidimensional view of the data reshaped to the requested shape. The total number of elements in the reshaped view must remain the same. The data is not copied: the reshaped ndview points to the same memory block as the original ndview.

parameterdescription.para: The number of dimensions in the reshaped multidimensional view.
The shape of the reshaped multidimensional view.

detaileddescription.para: Get 1-dimensional slice of 1-dimensional view. The slice is a view into the original memory block. The data is not copied: The sliced view points to the data within the same memory block as the original ndview.

parameterdescription.para: The starting index of the data slice within the input view.
The ending index of the data slice within the input view.

simplesect.para: The 1-dimensional view with a data slice.

detaileddescription.para: Get 2-dimensional row slice of 2-dimensional view. The slice is a view into the original memory block. The data is not copied: The sliced view points to the data within the same memory block as the original ndview.

parameterdescription.para: The starting row index of the data slice within the input view.
The ending row index of the data slice within the input view.

simplesect.para: The 2-dimensional view with a data slice containing data rows [from_row, ..., to_row) from the original view.

detaileddescription.para: Get 2-dimensional column slice of 2-dimensional view. The slice is a view into the original memory block. The data is not copied: The sliced view points to the data within the same memory block as the original ndview.

parameterdescription.para: The starting column index of the data slice within the input view.
The ending column index of the data slice within the input view.

simplesect.para: The 2-dimensional view with a data slice containing data columns [from_col, ..., to_col) from the original view.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a multidimensional array with the same shape as the view, but having the data allocated on host. The data from the view is copied to the array on host.

parameterdescription.para: The SYCL* queue object.
The vector of events that the operation depends on.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a multidimensional array with the same shape as the view, but having the data allocated in USM on device. The data from the view is copied to the array on device.

parameterdescription.para: The SYCL* queue object.
The vector of events that the operation depends on.

detaileddescription.para: Prefetches the data from high bandwidth memory to local cache. Should be submitted ahead the expected computations to have enough time for data transfer.

parameterdescription.para: The SYCL* queue object.

simplesect.para: The SYCL* event object indicating the availability of the data in the view for reading and writing.

briefdescription.para: Returns the pointer to the first element of the 1-dimensional view.
Returns the pointer to the past-the-last element of the 1-dimensional view.
Returns the constant pointer to the first element of the 1-dimensional view.
Returns the constant pointer to the past-the-last element of the 1-dimensional view.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new multidimensional view instance by passing the pointer to externally-defined memory block for mutable data.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional array.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new multidimensional view instance by passing the pointer to externally-defined memory block for immutable data.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional array.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new strided multidimensional view instance by passing the pointer to externally-defined memory block for mutable data.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional view.
The strides of the created multidimensional view.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new strided multidimensional view instance by passing the pointer to externally-defined memory block for immutable data.

parameterdescription.para: The pointer to a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional view.
The strides of the created multidimensional view.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new multidimensional view instance from a mutable array.

parameterdescription.para: The array that stores a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional view.

memberdef.argsstring: (const array< T > &data, const shape_t &shape, const shape_t &strides)
memberdef.name: wrap_mutable

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new strided multidimensional view instance from a mutable array.

parameterdescription.para: The array that stores a homogeneous data block.
The shape of the created multidimensional view.
The strides of the created multidimensional view.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new 1d view instance from an immutable array.

parameterdescription.para: The array that stores a homogeneous data block.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new 1d view instance from a mutable array.

parameterdescription.para: The array that stores a homogeneous data block.

memberdef.argsstring: (const T *data, const shape_t &shape, const shape_t &strides, bool data_is_mutable)
memberdef.name: ndview

detaileddescription.para: The class represents a multi-dimensional view of an externally-defined memory block with a fixed number of dimensions. The view does not own the memory block and does not perform any memory management.

parameterdescription.para: The type of elements in the view.
The number of dimensions in the view.
C-contiguous (row-major) or FORTRAN-contiguous (column-major) order of the elements in 2-dimensional view.
